@ profhardcore: Download and merge this reg file: http://www.*egaupload.co*/?d=9B2OGPXD then reboot and reinstall PowerDVD. If you get the same error then disable your virus scanner during the installation process. (replace the * in the link with m)

@ Coxy_UK: It's possible that your virus scanner blocks the keyboard shortcuts (false positive). Temporarily disable your virus scanner and test if the keyboard shortcuts work. If they work then add PowerDVD to the exclusion list.

@ Sebastian2008: Try updating your NVIDIA driver.

@ Ganddi: PowerDVD uses external codecs (DivX, Xvid, MatroskaSplitter) to play movies. If you are using Windows 7 or Vista, try Combined Community Codec Pack (CCCP).

@ b10lee: Its a known error,.. a lot of people are having the same problem: http://forum.cyberlink.com/forum/posts/list/10722.page
